Articles.Content: My jet is perfectly balanced with the center of mass right on the center of lift. But yet whenever i try to pitch my nose more than 5 degrees or so in either direction it just flips out. Is it part of the new aerodynamics? If so i hate it because i cant even manuver with it like that. Is there a way to fix it? Would Putting the center of lift behind the center of mass fix it?

Welcome aboard!

Yes, the general advice is to have the CoL slightly behind the CoM. Right on top of it makes for minimal stability.
It would most likely help matters quite a bit if you moved the center of lift a bit behind the center of mass, yes.

Im not new to the game lol. Ive had it for over 2 years. Its just that this is my first time with a KSP forum account :3

Thank you all. Now my jet doesnt flip out lol

This is one of the most helpfull posts i have read on the subject: [Basic Aircraft Design Explained Simply With Pictures](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/52080-Basic-Aircraft-Design-Explained-Simply-With-Pictures)

It is not up to date for 1.0.2 and some references are made to old aero that did not feature realistic drag. But the main jist of the post still holds.
